titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Albany County and Rensselaer County Courts records 1977.595
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T11:14-0500

did.unittitle: Albany County and Rensselaer County Courts records
did.abstract: Various records of the Albany and Rensselaer County Courts, including an affidavit from John Seelye (Albany County), a petition of Jacob Miller (Albany County), and an affidavit from David Bryan (Rensselaer County). Records date from 1793 and 1811.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Albany County and Rensselaer County Courts records, 1977.595, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
